attributes.action: Make the study of the British Empire (+crimes) compulsory in Secondary Schools
attributes.additional_details: Millions of Black, Asians and ethnic minorities call Britain their home. They are 3rd, 4th and even 5th generation Brits, however the education system fails every single one of them. It is compulsory to learn about WWI because of its impact and importance - the British Empire is also very significant. Children are uneducated leading to them growing up to being ignorant racists. British Children deserve to know where they came from.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for teenagers to study the British Empire, negatives and positives, it’s lasting impact till today, it’s crimes against ethnic minorities. Also, the involvement of the British in the slave trade which comes under the British Empire topic.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
